poem:
**The Campaign Awaits**

Cuomo strides into politics,  
a familiar shadow trailing—  
but see Rios at the corner café,  
a veteran with coffee-warmed hands,  
content in the rhythm of Brooklyn streets,  
speaking of simpler satisfactions—  
while ambition swirls beyond  
the rim of his steaming cup.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Andrew Cuomo enters race for New York mayor as frontrunner – but trailing baggage Abraham Rios, a 76-year-old army veteran and retiree, regularly meets friends at a coffee shop around the corner from his home in Brooklyn, and that is about all he does, he says. The Puerto Rican native who served in the Vietnam war is satisfied with the money he gets from social security and enjoys life, but he would like to see". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
